Structure.Name: EHF ESPD 1.0 Response
Structure.Description: Document type used by potential contracting parties to document their answers questioned in an ESPD Response.

Element.Name: UBL Version identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the earliest version of the UBL 2 schema for this document type that defines all of the elements that might be encountered in the current instance

Element.Name: Specification identification
Element.Description: An identification of the specification containing the total set of rules regarding semantic content, cardinalities and business rules to which the data contained in the instance document conforms. The identification may include the version of the specification as well as any customizations applied.

Element.Name: Document identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for this document, assigned by the sender. Use UUID (universally unique identifier), version 4

Element.Name: Copy indicator
Element.Description: Indicates whether this document is a copy (true) or not (false)

Element.Name: ESPD version
Element.Description: The version of the document that has been identified with the document identifier.

Element.Name: Issue date
Element.Description: The date, assigned by the sender, on which this document was issued. Must not include timezone information. Format YYYY-MM-DD

Element.Name: Issue time
Element.Description: The time, assigned by the sender, at which this document was issued. Format "hh:mm:ss", no timezone information allowed

Element.Name: Reference number
Element.Description: An identifier that is specified by the buyer and used as a reference number for all documents in the procurement process. It is also known as procurement project identifier, procurement reference number or contract folder identifier.

Element.Name: Consortium group name
Element.Description: The name of the Consortium or group to which the Economic Operator belongs for a specific procurement project

Element.Name: Economic operator
Element.Description: Any natural or legal person or public entity or group of such persons and/or entities, including any temporary association of undertakings, which offers the execution of works and/or a work, the supply of products or the provision of services on the market. Information about the party submitting the qualification. A placeholder for the data related to only one Economic Operator (EO) that tenders solely to a procurement project, to one of the EOs that tender as part of a group (e.g. a Consortium), or to one possible sub-contractor of the EO. Consortia grouping more than one EO need to draft and submit as many ESPDResponses as Economic Operators and sub-contractors participate in the tender.

Element.Name: SME indicator
Element.Description: Indicates whether the economic operator can be categorized as an SME (true) or not.According to the EC, SME are enterprises with less than 250 employees, a turnover less than EUR 50 m and a balance sheet total less than EUR 43 m.

Element.Name: Representative Natural person
Element.Description: Information about individuals who in one way or the other represent the economic operator.

Element.Name: Role description
Element.Description: A short description for the role of the Economic Operatorâ€™s representative

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: Country of registration of the natural person

Element.Name: Representative Natural person
Element.Description: Information about individuals who in one way or the other represent the economic operator.

Element.Name: Representative natural person first name
Element.Description: First name of the natural person.

Element.Name: Representative natural person first name
Element.Description: First name of the natural person.

Element.Name: Representative natural person birth date
Element.Description: Birth date of the natural person. Format YYYY-MM-DD

Element.Name: Representative natural person birth place
Element.Description: Birth place of the natural person.

Element.Name: Representative natural person contact information
Element.Description: Information about contact details for the representative natural person.

Element.Name: Representative natural person telephone
Element.Description: Telephone number to the natural person.

Element.Name: Representative natural person e-mail address
Element.Description: E-mail address to the natural person.

Element.Name: Postbox
Element.Description: A post office box number registered for postal delivery by a postal service provider.

Element.Name: Representative natural person street address
Element.Description: Street address to the natural person.

Element.Name: Representative natural person city
Element.Description: City of the natural person.

Element.Name: Representative natural person postal zone
Element.Description: Postal zone or zip code of the natural person.

Element.Name: Representative natural person country
Element.Description: Country of the natural person.

Element.Name: Representative natural person country code
Element.Description: Country code of the natural person.

Element.Name: Economic operator website
Element.Description: The website of the economic operator.
Unique identification number for the Economic Operator

Attribute.Description: The schemeID attribute specifies if it is a VAT number or another national number. The possible values are: VAT_Number and National_Number.

Element.Name: Economic operator name
Element.Description: The official name of the Economic Operator, as registered in a Business Register

Element.Name: Economic operator postal address
Element.Description: The address of the Economic Operator, as registered in a Business Register

Element.Name: Postbox
Element.Description: A post office box number registered for postal delivery by a postal service provider.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in an address. Usually the street name and number or post office box.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of a city where the address is located.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.

Element.Name: Contact point
Element.Description: The name of the contact point.

Element.Name: Contact telephone number
Element.Description: A phone number for the contact point.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: An e-mail address for the contact point.

Element.Name: Lot reference
Element.Description: A reference to one or more lots the economic operator is applying for. The original lot definition is part of the call for tender document. The Qualification instance only references the corresponding IDs in order to establish the connection to the call for tender information. The value Â´0 MUST be specified to indicate that this procurement project has no lots.

Element.Name: Criterion
Element.Description: A condition that the economic has to meet in order to not be excluded and be selected as a candidate for awarding in a procurement procedure.

Attribute.Name: Processing instruction
Attribute.Description: Reserved for non-standard processing of the class; e.g. for hiding or showing elements in a user interface

Element.Name: Criterion identifier
Element.Description: A language-independent token, e.g., a number, that allows to identify a criterion uniquely as well as allows to reference the criterion in other documents. Compulsory use of the UUIDs from the Criteria Taxonomy

Element.Name: Criterion type code
Element.Description: Code specifying the type of criterion, from the Criteria Taxonomy

Element.Name: Criterion name
Element.Description: A short and descriptive name for a criterion. A criterion describes a fact that is used by the contracting body to evaluate and compare tenders by economic operators and which will be used in the award decision or to assess the eligibility of an economic operator. Compulsory use of the names from the Criteria Taxonomy

Element.Name: Criterion description
Element.Description: An extended description of the criterion.Compulsory use of the descriptions from the Criteria Taxonomy
Element.Value: Has the economic operator itself or any person who is a member of its administrative, management or supervisory body or has powers of representation, decision or control therein been the subject of a conviction by final judgment for participation in a criminal organisation, by a conviction rendered at the most five years ago or in which an exclusion period set out directly in the conviction continues to be applicable? As defined in Article 2 of Council Framework Decision 2008/841/JHA of 24 October 2008 on the fight against organised crime (OJ L 300, 11.11.2008, p. 42).

Element.Name: Legislation reference
Element.Description: The specific piece(s) of Legislation(s) where the criterion is defined or mentioned

Attribute.Description: Language of the textual data provided for this reference to a legislation, if not specified it defaults to EN (English)

Element.Name: Legislation title
Element.Description: Title of the legislation as published in an official gazette or portal. The complete title of the legislation provided in the original legal text MUST be provided.
Element.Value: DIRECTIVE 2014/24/EU OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

Element.Name: Legislation description
Element.Description: Reminder label or short description of the Legislation

Element.Name: Jurisdiction level
Element.Description: Jurisdictional level of a particular Legislation

Element.Name: Legislation article
Element.Description: Textual description of the article of the Legislation; e.g. ''Article 61''

Element.Name: Legislation URI
Element.Description: URI that points at the text of a particular Legislation. In the case of European legislation, the URI MUST point at the multilingual EUR-LEX web-page; e.g. Directive 2014/24/EU

Element.Name: Criterion requirement group
Element.Description: A group of requirements with a specific structure relating to one Criterion

Attribute.Name: Processing instruction
Attribute.Description: In the case of the RequirementGroup element the ESPD Service uses this attribute to specify whether the elements within the group must be shown or not.

Element.Name: Criterion requirement group identifier
Element.Description: A language-independent token, e.g., a number, that allows to identify a group of requirements uniquely. Compulsory use of the UUIDs from the Criteria Taxonomy.

Element.Name: Criterion requirement
Element.Description: Requirement to fulfill an specific criterion.

Attribute.Name: Processing instruction
Attribute.Description: In the case of the RequirementGroup element the ESPD Service uses this attribute to specify whether the elements within the group must be shown or not.

Attribute.Name: Response data type
Attribute.Description: Type of response expected for this requirement; e.g. Indicator, Date, Description, etc.

Element.Name: Criterion requirement identifier
Element.Description: Identifier of the requirement that fulfills a specific criterion. Compulsory use of the UUIDs from the Criteria Taxonomy.

Element.Name: Criterion requirement description
Element.Description: Description of the requirement that fulfills a specific criterion. Compulsory use of the requirement description from the Criteria Taxonomy.

Element.Name: Criterion requirement response
Element.Description: Used by the economic operator to answer a specific Requirement issued by the contracting body.

Element.Name: Criterion response identifier
Element.Description: This id SHOULD be provided by the EO or the service provider that instantiates the ESPDResponse XML document

Element.Name: Criterion fulfillment indicator
Element.Description: Indicates a positive or a negative answer provided by the economic operator as an answer to a question in the Requirement. The only possible values are false and true

Element.Name: Criterion response description
Element.Description: A textual description of a criterion response that describes how an economic operators fulfills an specific criterion

Element.Name: Criterion fulfillment amount
Element.Description: Declared amount that fulfills this criterion.BEWARE that amounts can use decimal separators (e.g. 14134.95 but not hundred or thousand separators)

Element.Name: Criterion fulfillment code
Element.Description: A code pointing at a definition of a concept as the answer to the Requirement

Element.Name: Criterion fulfillment date
Element.Description: Declared date that fulfills this criterion. The date format MUST be 'YYYY-MM-DD', no time zone indicators to be used

Element.Name: Criterion fulfillment percenatge
Element.Description: Declared percentage that fulfills this criterion. Do not format the percentage with the "%" symbol, just provide a float value

Element.Name: Criterion fulfillment quantity
Element.Description: Declared quantity that fullfills the criterion. BEWARE that different types of Quantities can be required (see codelist ResponseDataType), some of them requires a unit code to be specified. Up to three different types of Quantities can be specified: (1) QUANTITY_INTEGER, a number representing a quantity in a specific unit of measure. The unit has to be specified (e.g. number of workers); (2) QUANTITY_YEAR, a non-negative integer (i.e. a natural number) representing a year. The unit has to be specified as YEAR, and (3) QUANTITY, a number representing a generic quantity with no unit specified (e.g. a ratio). Beware that in the case of QUANTITY_INTEGER and QUANTITY_YEAR the attribute unitCode MUST be always specified

Element.Name: Criterion fulfillment period
Element.Description: Declared period that fulfills the Criterion

Element.Name: Evidence
Element.Description: One or more references to a source where a documentary proof can be obtained to demonstrate that one stated response does actually fulfill the Requirement from a Criterion

Element.Name: Evidence name
Element.Description: The name of an evidence

Element.Name: Embedded evidence indicator
Element.Description: Indicates whether the Evidence is embedded in the XML document

Element.Name: Evidence issuer party
Element.Description: Reference to the (trusted) party responsible for issuing the Evidence

Element.Name: Evidence issuer name
Element.Description: Name of the trusted party issuing the evidence

Element.Name: Evidence identifier
Element.Description: The ID for this document. Must be a UUID of version 4 (random generated UUID); this value is used internally to identify this document reference.

Element.Name: External document URI
Element.Description: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies where the external document is located.

Element.Name: Response related party
Element.Description: A party that may be affected by the response provided by the economic operator
